p: Eugenol is present in numerous aromatic plants, such as Myristica fragrans Houtt. [ 74] and Ocimum basilicum L. [ 75]. The clove plant ( Eugenia caryophyllata Thunb.) is the principal source of this compound, representing 45â€“90% of the total EOs. A wide spectrum of biological properties has been reported for this molecule, including antioxidant, antimicrobial, anti-inflammatory, analgesic, and anticancer activities [ 76].
